text: Pittosporum coriaceum is a species of plant in the Pittosporaceae family. It is endemic to Macaronesia, and due to extinction in the Canary Islands, it is now restricted to the Portuguese Madeira Islands. Pittosporum coriaceum is a Critically endangered species due to habitat loss. ==References== coriaceum Category:Flora of Madeira Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Pittosporum coriaceum
